title: 104_s1200
content: The Act may be cited as the "Freedom and Human Rights for the Enclaved People of Cyprus Act". The Congress emphasizes the importance of promoting human rights, especially in allied countries, through US foreign policy. US foreign assistance should be used to end restrictions on freedoms and human rights for the enclaved people of Cyprus, including limitations on worship, communication, and possession of telephones in homes. The enclaved individuals in Cyprus face restrictions on communication, possession of telephones in homes, leaving the enclaved area without permission, censorship of mail, reporting requirements for males aged 18 to 50, and limitations on educational services beyond elementary school. Enclaved individuals in Cyprus face various restrictions, including limited communication, possession of telephones, leaving without permission, censorship of mail, reporting requirements for males aged 18 to 50, and limitations on education. They also experience violations of property rights, lack of compensation for work, and harassment, beating, rape, and murder without adequate protection or investigation. The United States is working to alleviate and eliminate restrictions on the enclaved people in Cyprus. The President is required to inform the United Nations and foreign governments about restrictions on the enclaved people of Cyprus, enlist their help in ending these restrictions, and establish US assistance programs for the enclaved. Funds allocated to governments imposing restrictions may be used to assist the enclaved. The President is mandated to notify the head of foreign governments annually about opposition to restrictions on the freedom and human rights of the enclaved people of Cyprus. Assistance programs will aim to eliminate these restrictions and return ancestral homes and lands to those affected. The President is required to notify foreign governments annually about the US opposition to restrictions on the freedom and human rights of the enclaved people of Cyprus. The Secretary of State must include a report on the enclaved people of Cyprus in the annual Department of State's Country Reports on Human Rights Practices. The President directs the US representative to the UN to urge action on the plight of enclaved people in Cyprus and calls for investigation and corrective action by the UN Human Rights Commissioner.
